title: Gross savings, less taxing; GST rejig expected to revive demand; FMCG packs to get cheaper
content: Ahead of the festive season, the GST cut on household staples and medicines is set to boost consumption and ease prices. Companies anticipate increased demand for various products, with tax cut benefits passed on through price reductions or increased grammage. This move is expected to energize consumer sentiment, particularly in rural areas, and stimulate growth in the FMCG sector.

title: Sitharamanâ€™s â€˜Diwali giftâ€™: From paneer to paratha, Centre explains tweaks in GST rates; FAQs
content: The GST Council has approved significant rate cuts across various sectors, effective September 22nd, providing relief to consumers and farmers. Daily-use items like hair oil, shampoo, and toothpaste will now attract a reduced 5% GST, while health and life insurance are entirely exempt.

title: Yamuna at 3rd highest level in 63 years, several areas flooded
content: Heavy discharge from Hathnikund barrage caused the Yamuna River to swell, crossing the 207-meter mark in Delhi and displacing around 12,000 people. The water level is expected to rise further, approaching the historic 1978 flood levels.

title: 'Don't even remember family': Pak cricketer on missing Babar, Rizwan
content: Faheem Ashraf cleverly addressed Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan's absence after Pakistan's loss to Afghanistan in the tri-series. He emphasized the team's focus on winning, even amidst missing key players. Both Babar and Rizwan were excluded due to recent poor T20I performances, while Pakistan prepares to face UAE in their next match.

title: Steve Jobsâ€™ last email to self on Apple ID; Writes: I donâ€™t make any of my own clothing
content: A personal email penned by Steve Jobs a year before his death has resurfaced, offering a rare glimpse into the Apple visionary's reflections. Sent to himself, the email reveals Jobs's profound gratitude for the countless contributions of others that shaped his life. He acknowledged his dependence on humanity, both past and present, for his well-being and existence.

title: â€˜Rent, rules & realityâ€™: US visa crackdown hits Indian students hard
content: Stricter visa enforcement and dwindling job opportunities are creating significant hardships for Indian students in the US. Many are facing financial strain due to revoked visas, workplace inspections, and limited work hours, forcing them to cut expenses drastically and seek family support.

title: Bajaj Electricals, UBL& more: Top stocks on brokers' radar today
content: Brokerage firms have issued varied ratings on several companies. HSBC maintains a buy rating on Glenmark Pharma, anticipating IGI to become self-funding and highlighting key FDA clearances. CLSA has an outperform rating on Indus Tower, despite concerns about its Africa expansion and dividend payouts. Citigroup suggests a buy for M&M Finance, noting improvements in risk management.

title: Guv's absolute discretion on bills means negating people's will: Bengal in SC
content: West Bengal has cautioned that granting governors the power to decide the fate of bills would undermine states' legislative functions. The Supreme Court's timeline for governors and the President would expedite the process of turning people's will into laws. The Constitution does not assign governors a dominating position in state legislative or executive functions, according to the TMC government.

title: â€˜Not hundreds of thousandsâ€™: Muskâ€™s daughter says sheâ€™s broke; opens up on fame, father
content: Vivian Wilson, Elon Musk's daughter, asserts her financial independence despite her father's wealth, sharing that she lives with roommates to save money. The aspiring model, who recently graced Teen Vogue, navigates newfound fame while striving to be recognized beyond her family connections. Wilson, who cut ties with Musk in 2022, aims to establish her own identity.

title: Massive revelation! 'I broke every rule in the book,' says Lalit Modi
content: Lalit Modi, the former IPL chairman, admitted to intentionally violating broadcasting regulations during the inaugural IPL match in 2008 to maximize viewership, overriding Sony's exclusive rights. Despite potential legal repercussions, Modi prioritized widespread access to ensure the tournament's success. This decision later led to contract disputes, investigations, and legal proceedings against Modi regarding alleged favoritism towards World Sports Group.

title: Bihar jail turns into a wedding venue for rape accused, survivor
content: In a rare turn of events, a jail in Madhubani, Bihar, became the venue for a wedding between an inmate and his widowed sister-in-law. The accused, facing charges of sexual exploitation, married the woman following a Patna High Court directive. The court granted bail on the condition that the marriage be verified.

title: 'Gukesh will lose his title': Uzbek GM's latest comment sparks controversy - Watch
content: Nodirbek Abdusattorov ignited a pre-tournament buzz by confidently predicting D Gukesh's title loss, adding intrigue to the FIDE Grand Swiss 2025. While Gukesh aims to test himself in the Swiss format despite already securing his title match spot, Abdusattorov's remark intensifies the competition, especially with Candidates Tournament qualification at stake for many participants.

title: â€˜A bet on myselfâ€™: Youngest female billionaire on why she left college early
content: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing and early entrepreneurial spirit. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship and founded successful ventures like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Gretzky and Canadaâ€™s crisis: From hero to fading icon - who defines hockey now?
content: Wayne Gretzky, once the undisputed symbol of Canadian hockey, is now being re-evaluated as the sport evolves. While his legacy remains significant, the rise of international stars and Canada's changing role in the global game have sparked an identity crisis. Canadians are urged to embrace a future where their hockey identity extends beyond a single figure.

title: Delhi rains: SpiceJet issues advisory; urges passengers to check flight status
content: SpiceJet issued a travel advisory due to heavy rains disrupting flight operations in Delhi, warning passengers of potential delays and cancellations. The India Meteorological Department forecasts continued rain and thunderstorms. Rising water levels in the Yamuna River prompted evacuations from low-lying areas, with authorities establishing relief camps and deploying disaster response teams.

title: 'Nobody knows who I am': Josh Allen on being overshadowed by wife Hailee Steinfeld
content: Josh Allen is navigating a new chapter, balancing his NFL career with supporting his wife, Hailee Steinfeld, a global celebrity. Allen humorously notes the shift in attention during international events like fashion weeks, where Steinfeld's fame takes center stage. He expresses admiration and pride for her accomplishments as they both pursue major milestones in their respective careers.

title: Kawhi Leonard name dragged into no-show endorsement scam
content: Kawhi Leonard, who joined the Clippers in 2019, is now linked to a fraudulent tree-planting company, Aspiration, allegedly funded by Steve Ballmer. Leonard reportedly signed a $28 million "no-show job" endorsement deal with Aspiration through KL2 Aspire LLC. The Clippers deny circumventing the salary cap, while Aspiration is under U.S. government investigation.

title: 'Nothing is working': Matthew Staffordâ€™s wife exhausted over parenting challenges
content: Kelly Stafford, wife of Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford, is candidly navigating the challenges of raising four daughters. She revealed struggles with one daughter's disrespectful behavior towards coaches and emotional outbursts. Despite parenting exhaustion and Matthew's demanding NFL schedule, Kelly balances family life, celebrating milestones like back-to-school while supporting her husband's preseason preparations for the upcoming 2025 season.

title: Jack Brady skips Gisele visit for special outing with mom Bridget Moynahan
content: Bridget Moynahan and her son Jack were spotted at the US Open, continuing their tradition at Arthur Ashe Stadium. This appearance followed Tom Brady's heartfelt social media tribute to Jack on his 18th birthday, highlighting their strong father-son bond. Despite Brady and Moynahan's past relationship, they maintain a respectful co-parenting dynamic, prioritizing their children's well-being.

title: 'Param Sundari' Day 6 box office: Sidharth-Janhvi starrer shines, crosses Rs 50cr worldwide
content: Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's 'Param Sundari' has grossed over Rs 50 crore worldwide in its first six days, marking a significant milestone for both actors. The romantic comedy, directed by Tushar Jalota, saw a midweek slowdown after a strong opening, but faces competition from 'Baaghi 4' which is releasing soon.

title: GST revamp: Life & health cover, white goods, most cars to get cheaper; reforms effective Sept 22
content: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the indirect tax system, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% slab for select goods. Effective September 22nd, these changes aim to reduce tax burdens on common goods, eliminate classification disputes, and boost consumption.

title: Relief for minority migrants from Afghanistan, Bangladesh & Pakistan
content: India's Immigration and Foreigners Act 2025, effective Monday, exempts persecuted minorities from Afghanistan, Bangladesh, and Pakistanâ€”Hindus, Christians, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains, and Parsisâ€”who arrived before December 31, 2024, from penalties for lacking valid documents. This exemption doesn't affect the Citizenship Amendment Act's citizenship criteria.

title: â€˜Coolieâ€™ BO collection day 21: Rajinikanthâ€™s action film slows down; earns Rs 1 crore
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is experiencing a slowdown in its third week after a massive opening. Despite a weekday dip, the film continues to draw audiences, showcasing Rajinikanth's star power. The movie has grossed over Rs 500 crore worldwide, even amid mixed audience reactions, with the director addressing speculation about time travel and cinematic universes.

title: Vaccine mandates in Florida set to end, state officials confirm
content: Florida is set to potentially eliminate all vaccine mandates, including those for schoolchildren, a move spearheaded by Surgeon General Dr. Joseph A. Ladapo and Governor Ron DeSantis. Dr. Ladapo, a known vaccine skeptic, has clashed with public health authorities in the past. The state plans to form a commission tied to Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to further this agenda.

title: GST rate cuts! What is cheaper & dearer? Check full list of items in each slab
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced significant GST rate cuts, effective September 22, bringing relief to the common man. Daily use items like hair oil, soaps, and toothpaste now fall under the 5% tax bracket. Several items, including ultra-high temperature milk and paneer, face zero tax. Air conditioners, TVs, and small cars are now taxed at 18%.

title: With GST rate cuts, govt expects lower prices to reach consumers
content: The government anticipates businesses will pass on the benefits of lower GST rates to consumers. The CBIC will engage with industry to ensure compliance, with indications suggesting a positive response. While the anti-profiteering agency is disbanded, the provision remains, and guidance will be issued for goods already in stock, allowing businesses to claim credit for the reduced tax.

title: Insider trading: Sebi asks banks to tighten controls; UPSI under watch
content: Sebi chief Tuhin Kanta Pandey urged listed banks to strengthen internal controls to prevent insider trading, emphasizing their dual responsibility in safeguarding unpublished price-sensitive information (UPSI) related to both the bank and its client companies. He highlighted that weak controls lead to stock market frauds and stressed the moral responsibility of banks' management in complying with insider trading regulations.

title: 'You just feel defective': Dwyane Wade's wife recalls struggle; opens up about health battle
content: Gabrielle Union bravely shared her challenging journey through perimenopause, beginning in her late 30s, and the emotional toll it took. Alongside this, she and Dwyane Wade faced fertility struggles and a miscarriage while trying to conceive. Ultimately, they found joy in welcoming their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy, and are now relishing parenthood.

title: SC grants bail after 17 years: Gawli exits Nagpur jail; family reunion on his mind
content: Arun Gawli, the notorious Mumbai don, was released from Nagpur Central Prison after the Supreme Court granted him bail in a 2007 murder case. After 17 years behind bars, Gawli expressed a desire to reconnect with his family and grandchildren. His release was marked by tight security due to threats from Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company.

title: â€˜Sheâ€™s a rockstarâ€™: Josh Allen hails Hailee; credits her for stability
content: Josh Allen acknowledges Hailee Steinfeld's fame, noting her 'rockstar' status during their travels abroad. He embraces playing 'second fiddle' and appreciates her success. Sources indicate their marriage has brought personal stability, enhancing his confidence and poise on the field, suggesting a positive impact on his performance and leadership.

title: After 11-year trial, 4 acquitted in fabricated 'gang-rape' case
content: In Etah, Uttar Pradesh, four men were acquitted after an 11-year gang-rape trial when the woman admitted the crime never occurred. The court ordered action against the woman and her husband for filing a false case, and against the investigating officer for a flawed investigation.

title: Major GST reforms: 0% levy on Indian breads, paneer and milk
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced significant GST rate cuts following the 56th GST Council meeting, implementing a two-tier structure of 5% and 18% effective September 22. The rate rationalization, supported by all states, aims to benefit the common man by consolidating rates and reallocating items across tax slabs.

title: Manipur talks: Centre, Kuki-Zo near pact; PM Modi visit expected Sept 12-13
content: Ahead of PM Modi's Manipur visit, the Centre, Manipur government, and Kuki-Zo insurgents are poised to extend their Suspension of Operations (SOO) agreement. Talks in Delhi show promise, potentially tweaking SOO terms to relocate Kuki-Zo camps and directly deposit remuneration to cadres.

title: Chiefs in Brazil: Kelce frets long ride; Mahomes jokes on geography
content: Kansas City Chiefs anticipate challenges for their upcoming game in Sao Paulo. Travis Kelce mentioned the long bus ride from the hotel to the stadium. Patrick Mahomes joked about teammates' understanding of global geography. The team will face an eleven-hour flight followed by a lengthy bus journey. Kelce is excited to see the fan reaction in Brazil.

title: Special GST slab of 40%: Which items are under this new tax category
content: The GST Council has approved a new 40% tax slab for sin and luxury goods, set to replace the existing cess. While the implementation date is pending, 5% and 18% slabs take effect from September 22. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the move, highlighting reduced tax burdens for the common person.

title: Monsoon fury: 500 death toll mounts to 500 in HP, J&K, Punjab, Haryana
content: Relentless monsoon rains have triggered devastating floods and landslides across Himachal Pradesh, J&K, Punjab, and Haryana, resulting in at least 500 deaths. Thousands are stranded as highways are blocked, rivers surge above danger levels, and crops are flattened. Punjab has declared a state of disaster, while rescue efforts continue amidst widespread destruction and infrastructure damage.

title: Meet Kindred Lubeck: Jeweler behind Taylorâ€™s engagement ring
content: Kindred Lubeck, a 30-year-old jeweler, has gained global recognition for co-designing Taylor Swift's engagement ring with Travis Kelce. Leaving her law firm job, Lubeck pursued her passion, launching Artifex Fine Jewelry in 2023. Overcoming doubts, she built her New York City studio without loans. Lubeck's journey highlights the power of resilience and passion, resonating with creatives and athletes alike.

title: Dowry case: 'Jump', says hubby, terrified woman flings self from 2nd-floor house, critical
content: In Aligarh's Daunkoli village, Archana, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly jumped from her roof after enduring years of dowry-related abuse. A video surfaced showing the aftermath, leading to a police case against her husband and in-laws. They are accused of demanding additional dowry of Rs 5 lakh and a motorcycle.

title: GST rate cuts from September 22! All you need to know about new tax rates for items - 75 FAQs answered
content: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax system, slashing rates on several everyday items. Roti, hair oil, ice creams, and televisions are set to become cheaper. We answer 75 FAQs about the GST rate rationalisation:

title: Rape case: AAP MLA says he feared encounter; denies attack on police
content: Punjab Police are actively searching for AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, who is accused of sexual exploitation and other charges. Pathanmajra released a video denying allegations of attacking police during an attempted arrest in Haryana.

title: School bells stop ringing in flood-hit North India as water cuts off access
content: Floods across north India have severely disrupted education, leaving students like Suresh Rawat unable to attend school after a bridge washed away. Schools in Punjab, Himachal, and Jammu have been repeatedly closed due to flooding and landslides. Damaged infrastructure, stranded teachers, and lack of access have halted classroom routines, with makeshift arrangements proving insufficient.

title: 'Common man to benefit': PM Modi hails GST rate cuts; calls it wide-ranging reform
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced next-generation GST reforms. These reforms aim to improve citizens' lives and ease business operations. The GST Council agreed to rate cuts and reforms proposed by the Union Government. Nirmala Sitharaman announced major GST rate cuts, implementing a two-tier tax system. Common man and middle-class items will see reduced rates.

title: Hockey Asia Cup: India settle for 2-2 draw against South Korea in Super 4s match in Rajgir
content: India faced a disappointing start in the Super4s stage of the Asia Cup, drawing 2-2 with South Korea after leading early. Despite Hardik Singh's initial goal, South Korea surged ahead with two quick goals. Harmanpreet Singh's late assist to Mandeep Singh salvaged a draw, but India's poor finishing and missed penalty corners highlighted a lackluster performance.

title: Osaka returns to US Open semis 5 years after title
content: Naomi Osaka kept up her resurgent run at the US Open, eliminating No. 11 Karolina Muchova 6-4, 7-6 (3) on Wednesday night to return to the semifinals at Flushing Meadows for the first time since winning the title five years ago.

title: 49ers add $3M in incentives to WR Jennings' deal
content: The 49ers and Jauan Jennings have reached agreement on a deal that will add $3 million in play-time incentives to his contract.

title: FSU player was shot in back of head, father says
content: Florida State's Ethan Pritchard was shot in the back of the head Sunday night, his father said, and remains in stable condition at Tallahassee Memorial Hospital.

title: Sources: NBA ASG to have 2 U.S. teams, 1 World
content: The 2026 NBA All-Star Game will likely be a round-robin tournament consisting of three eight-player teams -- two USA teams and one World team -- sources told ESPN.

title: Meyers says Raiders future unclear amid talks
content: Raiders receiver Jakobi Meyers, who is in the final year of his deal, is unsure if a new contract will get done with the organizatiion: "We're gonna see how it plays out."

title: Reese critical of Sky: 'Not settling' for repeat of '25
content: Angel Reese was critical of the state of the Sky amid another losing season, telling the Chicago Tribune that improving the team's roster is "a non-negotiable" for her.

title: Report: Clippers skirted cap with Kawhi payment
content: The Clippers reportedly have been accused of circumventing the NBA's salary cap by paying $28 million to Kawhi Leonard for a "no-show job."

title: Sources: Thompson off to London for Chelsea talks
content: Angel City FC forward Alyssa Thompson boarded a London-bound plane from Los Angeles on Wednesday as six-time reigning English champions Chelsea attempt to finalize a deal for the American, multiple sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: ðŸ¤” The 11 biggest fantasy questions for Week 1
content: How the Bears' offense will look, TreVeyon Henderson's role and Travis Hunter's snap count are among the curiosities.

content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: 'I'm going to be that person:' Eagles' A.J. Brown wants more for himself, and for others
content: All indications point to Brown being "hungrier than ever," as the Eagles begin to defend their title.

title: The ultimate upset: How Amanda Anisimova beat Iga Swiatek
content: Fewer than two months ago, Swiatek bested Anisimova in the Wimbledon final 6-0, 6-0. On Wednesday, Ansimova got her revenge.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Best-case scenarios for all 13 teams to end the season
content: From home-court advantage in the first round to awards, here's what each team is playing for down the stretch.

title: How the relationship between Parsons and the Cowboys broke down
content: The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones charted a course for Micah Parsons' exit from Dallas.

title: The Life of a (halftime) Showgirl? Roger Goodell says Taylor Swift a 'maybe' for Super Bowl LX
content: The pop superstar, who is engaged to Travis Kelce, could serve as the headliner for the Super Bowl LX halftime show.

title: Matchup rankings: Chase Brown, Emeka Egbuka stand out in Week 1
content: Here are the most and least favorable matchups at quarterback, running back, wide receiver and tight end.

title: LeBron, Kobe and the scars that led to Redeem Team gold in 2008
content: Following a disappointing bronze medal in the 2004 Olympics, the 2008 Team USA roster was out for redemption.

title: USMNT transfer grades: Analyzing every American move in the summer window
content: A bunch of USMNT players have been on the move. Let's grade them all, from Matt Turner to Gio Reyna and everyone in between ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: Judging the MLB trade deadline -- one month later
content: A look at where all 30 teams stand ahead of the final stretch -- and if their deadline deals have actually paid off.

title: From walk-offs to blowouts to ... did that really just happen?! All of the ways the Rockies have lost games in 2025
content: Colorado has lost games in practically every way imaginable this season. We look back on how the team reached 100 losses.

title: Can you import an entire offense? OU hopes so with John Mateer, Ben Arbuckle
content: OU is the latest team to bring in a new playcaller and QB to boost offense. The Sooners need big things from Mateer and Arbuckle.

title: AP Week 1 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: College football came back in a big way this past weekend, with high-profile matchups and some surprise scores. Now it's time to look forward for the country's best teams.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ men's college basketball teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: Five months from Olympics, here's what you should know about Team USA men's hockey
content: Will Matthew Tkachuk be healthy enough to play? Can Tage Thompson crack the lineup? We look at some of the biggest topics coming out of the recent orientation camp.

title: WSL preview: Chelsea, City, Arsenal to fight for title? Liverpool, Spurs in danger?
content: Chelsea have won the last six WSL titles, but will they focus on UWCL glory? How will promoted London City do? And could Liverpool, Spurs drop down?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United still open to Onana exit
content: Manchester United's AndrÃ© Onana could still leave the club in the next few weeks. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Italian Grand Prix at Monza: All the times, stats and facts to know
content: Formula 1 heads to Monza, the Temple of Speed and home of Ferrari for round 16 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and latest news.

title: Weekly pickups: Jonah Tong, Payton Tolle lead fantasy playoff picks
content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Sewage treatment plant proposed to address wastewater flowing through Coimbatore International Airport
content: The untreated sewage has led to foul odour spreading across the airport and nearby residential areas, a matter that has been repeatedly raised with civic officials.

title: Daily working hours allowed to go up from 9 to 10 hours in Maharashtraâ€™s private sector as State cabinet plans to amend laws
content: The move is aimed at attracting investments, generating employment and safeguarding workers' rights, an official statement said

title: Chandrababu Naidu denounces YSRCPâ€™s â€˜fake campaignâ€™ on fertilizer supply, warns of stern action
content: The State has 94,892 MT of urea available as on September 3 and that the Central government has allotted an additional 53,000 MT, which will reach in about 10 days, the Chief Minister asserts; he also advises farmers to keep away from politics

title: SIT files B Report in gang rape case against Munirathna
content: The investigation found no contact between the complainant and the MLA and found no evidence to substantiate the allegations made, leading the police to file a B report in the case

title: Dalit Subbiah: A revolutionary musicianâ€™s life celebrated in award-winning Tamil documentary at IDSFFK
content: A film about a seemingly docile revolutionary turns quickly into a the celebration of a superstar in Dalit Subbiah â€” Voice of the Rebels, the film that won the best long doc at IDSFFK

title: Fake SHGs siphoned off â‚¹56 crore during 2019-24, says 20-Point programme chief Lanka Dinakar
content: Stating that cases have been filed against those responsible, he says biometric authentication linked to Aadhaar has been introduced to prevent duplicate membership and fake groups

title: TCS Delivery Centre in Vizag likely to start operations in September
content: A deadline of September 20 has been set to complete all infrastructure and internal works at the TCS office in Rushikonda Hill, says official

title: Kolkataâ€™s oldest bookshop opens a free library at its historic College Street premises
content: Dasgupta and Co. has created a public library mainly with the intention of benefiting students who canâ€™t afford books; an online library is also on the anvil

title: Rajasthan Assembly passes Bill to regulate coaching centres amid Oppositionâ€™s protest
content: Congress MLAs protested against the introduction of the Bill with â€œwatered downâ€ provisions and said the BJP government was playing into the hands of coaching institutes

title: U.S. firm Jaggaer opens GCC in Hyderabad, plans to ramp hiringÂ Â
content: The facility has 180 employees and there are plans to raise the headcount to 500 in coming years, the firm said

title: Rift among Indian scientists as International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics bans Israel from future editions
content: More than 500 academics petitioned to suspend Israelâ€™s official participation in the International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics, prompting a backlash from 300 Indian scientists who urged the Prime Minister to take strict action

title: Six family members get life imprisonment for murder in Odisha
content: â€œAfter nearly three years, Additional Sessions Judge Bishnu Prasad Mishra convicted Anant Pujari, Siba Shankar Pujari, Chandan Pujari, Dumar Pujari and Dalimba Pujari under Sections 302 and 149 IPC. A juvenile involved in the crime was tried separately and also sentenced to life imprisonment,â€ said Santosh Mishra, Additional Public Prosecutor

title: Apex Manipur Naga body announces trade embargo from September 8
content: The restriction on trade and transportation of goods follows the Centreâ€™s â€œindifferenceâ€ to pleas against scrapping the Free Movement Regime and fencing the India-Myanmar border

title: Small cars, bikes up to 350 cc to get cheaper as GST reforms kick in
content: Petrol, LPG and CNG vehicles of less than 1,200 cc and not more than 4,000 mm length and diesel vehicles of up to 1,500 cc and 4,000 mm length would move to the 18% rate from the current 28%

title: Reviving MGNREGS in West Bengal
content: The Centre, State, and local bodies must act now to restore this lifeline â€” ensuring that no worker is left behind

title: High coliform levels detected on four stretches of Periyar
content: The analysis of water samples was done as part of the CPCBâ€™s National Water Quality Monitoring Programme

title: Infopark phase-3: GCDA to deploy dedicated team of officials for land-pooling
content: GCDA becomes first local body to act as â€˜appropriate authorityâ€™; â€˜300 acres to be identified based on various parametersâ€™

title: UDF, BJP contest final voterâ€™s list in Ernakulam
content: UDF leader alleges 142 voters from his ward were included in another; BJP claims delimitation and list preparation were faulty

title: Railway police in Ernakulam flag alarming trend of â€˜hit and robâ€™ cases
content: Of the six major theft cases registered by the Ernakulam railway police in August, four pertained to offenders snatching mobile phones and other valuables after attacking those who travel by sitting on footboards of train

title: Notorious gangster deported from Cambodia, arrested by Haryana STF
content: Mainpal Badli, wanted in two dozen cases of murder, attempt to murder, dacoity and robbery, had jumped parole in 2018, and fled to Mauritius, then Indonesia before settling at Siem Reap in Cambodia.

title: Youth dies after pilot car in Trinamool Congress MLAâ€™s hits motorbike
content: The Registration Certificate of the vehicle which met with the accident had expired a year ago raising questions as to how such a vehicle could be used for pilot car services.

title: Students cautioned against falling prey to drug menace
content: EAGLE emphasises need for prevention of crimes, says students will be made active part of the governmentâ€™s fight against drugs, highlights parentsâ€™ role in guiding children in the right path

title: Search on for bike rider who sped past over rail platform
content: The youth reportedly rode a premium bike onto the second platform of the station and sped past the passengers

title: Police lathi-charge farmers waiting for fertilizer in Rewa as shortage problem worsens in Madhya Pradesh
content: The incident took place at Rewaâ€™s Karahiya Mandi, where several farmers were waiting to collect tokens for fertlizer, with some alleging that they had been waiting for at least 48 hours and mismanagement on part of the administration

title: Bhutanâ€™s PM Dasho Tshering Tobgay visits Nalanda University in Rajgir
content: He described Nalanda as a vast city of scholarship and spirituality, producing great masters and shaping Buddhist traditions that continue to flourish in Bhutan.

title: COP-30 curtain raiser in Kolkata raises alarms for the Sundarbans deltaâ€™s severe erosion and rising sea levels
content: Activists and leaders call for global action and immediate technological and financial support to restore the ecologically sensitive delta

title: Maratha quota row: â€˜Who are you to give Kunbi certificates,â€™ Bhujbal questions his own government
content: â€œThis order will definitely affect the OBCs. I am in the process of taking legal consultation,â€ NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal said; he also warned of a mass protest

title: â‚¹398 crore flyover project to ease east-west traffic congestion in Mehdipatnam
content: The flyover project in the area comes exactly 20 years after the conceptualisation of the PVNR Expressway that was completed in 2009 under a Congress government

title: Amit Shah asks Tamil Nadu BJP leaders to desist from commenting on OPS, Dhinakaran
content: The core group was asked to identify Assembly seats where the BJP might contest in alliance with the AIADMK in 2026, although no number was provided

title: Flyers without mobility issues can pay for wheelchair: DGCA
content: Proposal part of draft norms placed for stakeholder consultations ahead of Bombay High Court hearing on September 25 after the court ordered an expert committee to examine the issue of wheelchair availability at airports

title: GST Council approves two-rate tax slab effective September 22
content: Govt retains 5% and 18% slabs; reforms carried out with focus on common man, says Finance Minister; products such as soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, bicycles may cost less with inclusion in 5% slab

title: T.N. restricts provision of â€˜guard of honourâ€™ during official visits of VIPs in connection with State government functions
content: The State government has decided that these seven personages â€œshall only be entitled to a guard of honour during their official visit to Tamil Nadu in connection with the State government functionsâ€

title: India, EFTA trade pact to come into force from October 1: Switzerland
content: Under the pact, India has received an investment commitment of $100 billion in 15 years from the grouping while allowing several products such as Swiss watches, chocolates and cut and polished diamonds at lower or zero duties

title: Reservation roster faces criticism for â€˜favouring general categoryâ€™
content: The new roster violates the guidelines and is against the roster announced in 2022, says Karnataka State SC/ST Government Employees Association president D. Chandrashekaraiah

title: BJP to hold meetings with partners on Bihar strategy
content: Discussions with NDA partners to be held in every Assembly seat over the next three weeks;Â Leaders to rally against offensive language aimed at PMâ€™s mother

title: T.T.V. Dhinakaran exits NDA even as Amit Shah seeks to mend relations
content: Mr. Dhinakaran reiterates the AMMK had unconditionally joined the NDA during the 2024 Parliamentary elections only to ensure Narendra Modiâ€™s return as Prime Minister for the third time

title: Centre issues guidelines to co-locate 11 lakh anganwadis on nearest school premises
content: Co-location eases transition from pre-school to primary school, aids curriculum alignment, community participation; so far, 2.9 lakh anganwadis have been co-located or mapped with schools with Class 1

title: Assam Jatiya Parishad protests extension of CAA deadline
content: The AJP termed the extension of the deadline as the â€œbiggest crimeâ€ ever committed against Assamese people, and accused the Bharatiya Janata Party-led government of perpetuating historical injustice

title: Navarroâ€™s â€˜Brahminâ€™ remarks reflect utter ignorance: Suhag A. Shukla
content: Rather than basing his arguments for tariffs on logic or sound reasoning, heâ€™s showing a preference towards sycophancy combined with racist colonial stereotypes, says HAF Executive Director

title: Supreme Court has championed the right to dignity through multiple judgments: CJI
content: The Supreme Court has intervened to declare human dignity as a â€˜Constitutional value that remains inviolable, even within the confines of incarcerationâ€™, the CJI said

title: Tejashwi Yadav hits back at PM, says his remarks on motherâ€™s insult a â€˜dikhawatiâ€™
content: The RJD leader questions timing of Prime Minsterâ€™s remarks, says he was laughing when abroad but began speaking about the insult to his mother once he returned to India

title: NHRC issues notice to Punjab government over reports of stray dog seen carrying babyâ€™s head near Patiala government hospital
content: Citing media reports, NHRC says patient attendants alleged poor sanitation, negligence, but medical superintendent says no baby missing from hospital; Punjab Chief Secy, police asked to report in two weeks

title: India killed U.S. with tariffs, now offers â€˜no tariffsâ€™: Trump
content: Donald Trump said he â€œunderstood tariffs better than any human being in the worldâ€ and with his tariffs, the other countries â€œwere all dropping themâ€

title: Karnataka High Court declines to interfere with policy for compulsory use of 20% jute bags for packing sugarÂ Â
content: A judge cannot assume the role of â€˜super adviserâ€™, says the court; It is for standing advisory committee to examine whether jute batching oil causes serious health hazards, it adds

title: Ramanagar sends the message of harmony, as Christians and Muslims join Ganeshotsav
content: For the last four years, along with Hindus, Christians and Muslims have been actively involving themselves in rituals during the celebrations

title: Aged petitioner pulled up for demanding acknowledgement at Ungaludan Stalin camp
content: Revenue officials refused to give an acknowledgement as the man had been petitioning various authorities on the same issue many times earlier; video of an SI hitting the petitioner went viral across social media platforms

title: Onam celebrations: security bolstered in State capital
content: A force of nearly 1,200 police personnel will be deployed across various event venues and public spaces during the course of the festivities

title: Denial of bail to Khalid, others a travesty of justice, bid to silence dissent: Left parties
content: The CPI (M) said that no action has been taken against BJP leaders Kapil Mishra and Anurag Thakur, whose allegedÂ â€œincendiary speeches actually fuelled the same Delhi communal riotsâ€

title: Kerala HC seeks clarity on Global Ayyappa Sangamam
content: The devaswom boardâ€™s counsel informs the court that the event is being organised exclusively by the TDB and that the State government was only offering support for crowd management

title: â€˜Help speed up EU FTAâ€™: Jaishankar presses Germany on FTA; Ukraine war also discussed
content: Krithi Shetty paints a story in every frame Bigg Boss Malayalam fame Sreethu Krishnanâ€™s beautiful looks: 8 hacks to beat the fungus growth on silk sarees during monsoon 10 Baby names inspired by gemstones In life and 'death': The frog that almost â€˜diesâ€™ every winter, but comes back to life How to grow expensive lettuce for salad in balcony garden and the best time to sow it The rainbow of the wild: 10 colourful and rare insects across the globe Mixing this one ingredient in your Mehendi can give your hair a natural black colour 10 freshwater aquarium fish that grow too big for small tanks Shweta Tiwariâ€™s top 10 ultra-glam looks that prove sheâ€™s aging in reverse

title: Big relief: 0% GST on individual health, life insurance; reduced from 18%
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: The Algebra Of Alliances: Bihar's Political Chessboard In 2025
content: In the hot and humid heartland of Bihar, shaped like a griddle, where the Ganges flows as both lifeblood and metaphor, the stage is set for a political drama that is as much about loyalty as it is about ambition.

title: Relief Camps Flooded As Yamuna Swells Above Danger Mark, Heavy Rainfall Batters Delhi-NCR, Punjab
content: Relief camps in low-lying areas of Delhi, including those near Mayur Vihar Phase-I, were inundated on Thursday as the Yamuna River swelled dangerously above the danger mark following incessant rainfall.

title: Only 5% And 18% GST Slabs From September 22. 40% For Super Luxury Items
content: The complicated GST slabs that gave headaches to small traders after the flagship tax overhaul came into effect eight years ago, was cleaned up by the government today, leaving only two slabs -- 5 and 18 per cent.

title: Putin Calls Unipolar World "Unfair", Backs Multipolar Order Without "Hegemons"
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday advocated for the end of a "unipolar world", emphasising a multipolar global order where all nations are equal without any "hegemons" dominating politics or security.

title: Why No Action Against Russia? Trump Snaps At Reporter With "India" Reply
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he put secondary sanctions on India for buying Russian oil and indicated that he hasn't done "phase two yet or phase three."

title: UP Man Assaulted By Wife, Family Members Over Samosas; Case Filed
content: An FIR on charges of attempt to murder was on Wednesday registered after a man was allegedly beaten up by his wife and her relatives during a village panchayat convened over a trivial dispute of his failure to bring samosas.

title: Delhi, Haryana Chief Ministers Hold Talks As Drain Breach Floods Villages
content: A breach in the Mungeshpur drain near Bahadurgarh in Haryana's Jhajjar district has flooded parts of the DelhiHaryana border, forcing the evacuation of nearly 2,000 people and triggering overnight repair and relief efforts.

title: "Welcome But Too Late": Congress's P Chidambaram On GST Reforms
content: Senior Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP P Chidambaram has welcomed the Centre's recent GST rationalisation and rate cuts but criticised the move as being "8 years too late".

title: Google Must Pay $425 Million In Class Action Over Privacy, Rules Court
content: A federal jury determined on Wednesday that Alphabet's Google must pay $425 million in a class action lawsuit that accused it of continuing to collect data for millions of users who had switched off a tracking feature in their Google account.

title: Maharashtra To Amend Laws For Longer Private Sector Work Hours
content: The Maharashtra cabinet on Wednesday gave its approval to amend laws that will allow increasing the maximum daily working hours for private sector employees from the present nine to 10 hours.

title: Trump Says China Should Have Mentioned US During "Beautiful Ceremony"
content: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that China's "beautiful ceremony" marking the end of World War Two should have highlighted the role that the U.S. played in Japan's defeat.

title: US Court Reverses Trump's Cuts Of Billions Of Dollars To Harvard
content: A federal judge in Boston on Wednesday ordered the reversal of the Trump administration's cuts to more than $2.6 billion in funding research grants for Harvard University.

title: "Historic Decision": Amit Shah, Rajnath Singh Laud PM Modi For GST Reforms
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the GST reforms and called it a "historic decision" to cut tax rates.

title: 15 Killed, 18 Injured After Streetcar Derails In Lisbon
content: An electric streetcar that is one of Lisbon's landmarks and a big draw for tourists derailed Wednesday, killing 15 people and injuring 18 others, emergency services said.

title: "Pro-Poor, Growth-Oriented Decision": Chandrababu Naidu Praises GST Reforms
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu hailed the Goods and Services Tax (GST) reforms approved by the GST Council as "pro-poor" and "growth-oriented".

title: "Behaves Like Pomeranian Dog...": Karnataka BJP MLA's Shocker On Woman Cop
content: A BJP MLA in Karnataka is under fire over his disparaging remarks against a woman Superintendent of Police (SP), saying that she was acting like a pet dog of Congress leaders in Davanagere district.

title: New GST Reform Will Boost Consumer Sentiment, Industry Confidence: Deloitte
content: The GST revamp that slashes tax rates on goods and services into a simplified two-slab structure addresses deeper structural changes, prioritising the "real drivers of the economy", says Deloitte India.

title: "Does Congress Want Tobacco Taxed At 5%?" Nirmala Sitharaman On 40% GST Question
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday announced a sweeping reduction in Goods and Services Tax (GST) rates on a wide range of essential items, automobiles, agriculture inputs, and electronic appliances.

title: GST Implication To Be Rs 48,000 Crore, Not Right To Call It Loss: Official
content: The government's big move to rationalise the Goods and services Tax may not lead to a loss, Revenue Secretary Arvind Shrivastava told reporters this evening as the new, simplified tax slabs were announced.

title: Video: Kim Jong Un's Staff Cleans DNA Traces After His Meeting With Putin
content: After North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin wrapped up in Beijing, North Korean aides rushed in to wipe his seat.

content: the Seminoles rose the highest in this week's AP Poll . Florida State beat Alabama as 13.5-point underdogs fall to no. 21 . only four conferences are represented in the poll, according to ESPN Research .

title: 'He's not trying to be a celebrity': How Justin Fields differs from Aaron Rodgers
content: a week 1 win means more for Justin Fields than for Aaron Rodgers, who is still building his career . he summoned the quarterback to new jersey and fired him in a meeting that turned contentious . "i respected it," one player said, reflecting on how he felt at the time .

title: Canelo, Crawford, Mayweather: Top 25 boxers of the century
content: two of the best fighters of this generation meet on sept. 13 at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas . undisputed super middleweight champion canelo Alvarez meets junior middleweight champ Terence Crawford . a list of 25 retired fighters to step into the ring has been put together by ESPN .

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in NFL's Week 1
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the easiest and most fun games to play this season . pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . if they lose, you are out . the biggest favorites tend to win the most over the long run .

title: Updated SP+ rankings for all 136 FBS teams
content: in a single sentence, it's a tempo- and opponent-adjusted measure of college football efficiency . it does not automatically give credit for big wins or particularly brave scheduling . early in the season, ratings are based primarily on preseason projections .

title: Why Dwight Howard absolutely belongs as a first-ballot Hall of Famer
